news.title: ZIFA elections: Former footballers speak out
news.content:
Story by Mthokozisi Dube
FORMER Zimbabwe Football Association (ZIFA) vice president and seasoned administrator, Peter Dube, has set his sights on completing the task he left prematurely ten years ago.
Dube is one of the candidates vying for the ZIFA Vice Presidency.
Dube believes he has what it takes to contribute to the development of local football.
“I was at ZIFA 10 years back, and you know what happened. Now is the time for us to complete the task we left. We want to improve the football ecosystem where everyone feels part of the journey to transform Zimbabwean football,” Dube said.
“We are happy the secretariat has been put in place. We are not inventing anything new. Football has its governing statutes. What we need is to follow those principles and guidelines.
“We are confident with the available secretariat, we can bring back the lost glamour in our game.”

news.title: Former Dynamos manager Richard Chihoro dies
news.content:
Story by Anashe Murombedzi, Sports Reporter
The Zimbabwean football community has been plunged into mourning following the death of former Dynamos manager, Richard Chihoro.

news.title: Khama Billiat joins Scottland FC
news.content:
Story by Tafadzwa Mavhangira
Warriors star forward, Khama Billiat has joined Castle Lager Premier Soccer League debutants Scottland FC on a free transfer after the expiry of his contract with Yadah FC.
The club confirmed the development through their official X handle this Thursday.
The 34-year-old Billiat becomes yet another strong addition to the Scottland FC squad after the new boys signed off Soccer Star of the Year Walter Musona who captained Simba Bhora to their maiden premiership title last year.
The league debutants have also lured soccer star of the year finalist, Kingsley Mureremba from CAPS United and Coach of the year Tonderai Ndiraya from Simba Bhora.
Meanwhile, Simba Bhora are reportedly working behind the scenes to strengthen their squad after losing Musona.
Although the club is yet to make any announcement, there are indications Dynamos midfielder, Donald Mudadi and CAPS United goal-minder, Tonderai Mateyaunga are heading to Shamva.
Mudadi and Mateyaunga took to their Facebook pages to announce their departure from the capital to Simba Bhora.

news.title: Lulu hunts for new club as he returns back home
news.content:
Story by Mthokozisi Dube
Former Highlanders head coach, Mandla Mpofu has opened up on his stint in the Botswana Premier League after being relieved of his duties a few days before the festive season break.
Compared to his two fellow countrymen, Madinda Ndlovu and the late Rahman Gumbo who left an indelible mark in the Botswana Premier League, Mpofu has found the going tough.
Lulu was released by Sua Flamingoes before the festive season break following a string of poor results which saw the club slump to fourth position with 13 points from 12 games.

news.title: Zimbabwe to host Women’s Handball Tournament
news.content:
Story by Anashe Murombedzi
Zimbabwe is set to make its mark on the international handball scene as the country prepares to host the International Handball Federation (IHF) Trophy Zone VI women’s junior and youth tournament in April.
The country’s successful bid to host the event has been described as testament to its growing reputation as a hub for handball in Africa.
The tournament, scheduled to take place in Harare from the 28th of April to the 4th of May, will bring together top teams from the region, all vying for a spot in the continental phase.
Secretary of the Zimbabwe Handball Federation Edison Chirowodza said, “This tournament is set to be hosted in Harare and winners will take part in the continental championship which will be held later and ultimately the continental winners will proceed to the world youth and juniors qualifiers.”
